agency_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides home delivered meals to persons in need.
site_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Delivers lunches to home-bound seniors and persons with disabilities for a small fee. An optional light evening meal is also available. A physician's diet prescription is required.
site_details: To apply: Visit www.hcmealsonwheels.org/apply or call 317-745-3469.  -- Contact physician to have diet prescription faxed. -- If you need financial assistance for the cost of your meals, it may take up to 30 days to process your application and begin meal delivery.
site_eligibility: Home-bound or unable to prepare meals due to illness, age, or disability -- With physician's diet prescription

agency_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF HENDRICKS COUNTY

site_eligibility: Home-bound or unable to prepare meals due to illness, age, or disability -- With physician's diet prescription

agency_desc: A community food pantry serving those in need in and around the town of Amo.
service_description: A food pantry providing perishable and non-perishable items which may include household cleaning supplies.
site_eligibility: Living in City of Amo, Clay Township. Persons outside this area may visit one time.

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit mental health support agency that promotes mental wellness in the community by providing information, referral, education, mental health advocacy and support.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Provides a safe social outlet for veterans living with mental illness who are treatment compliant. Offers members opportunities to socialize, gain peer approval, access computer classes/games, receive referrals to area resources, enjoy outings, and build life skills to help maintain their path to wellness.
site_details: Walk in. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Veterans living with a mental illness or in recovery who are treatment compliant

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit mental health support agency that promotes mental wellness in the community by providing information, referral, education, mental health advocacy and support.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Provides a court-ordered class for divorcing parents. This class is mandated for all divorcing parents with children under the age of 18. Spouses are not permitted to attend the same class. Class is typically offered two (2) to three (3) times per month, based on need.
site_details: Call to register.
site_schedule: Courses: Offered twice a month with both morning and evening hours available -- Registration: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm
site_eligibility: Court ordered by Hendricks County judges

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit mental health support agency that promotes mental wellness in the community by providing information, referral, education, mental health advocacy and support.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Provides information about and referrals to mental health and addiction resources in Hendricks County. Promotes public awareness and education around mental health and substance abuse issues.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Offers a monthly support group for family and friends that have lost a loved one to addiction.
site_details: Walk in through main entrance and go to Small Conference Room.
site_eligibility: Experienced lost of a loved one to addiction

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit mental health support agency that promotes mental wellness in the community by providing information, referral, education, mental health advocacy and support.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Provides a safe social outlet for adults living with mental illness who are treatment compliant. Offers members opportunities to socialize, gain peer approval, enjoy outings, and build life skills to help maintain their path to wellness.
site_details: Visit website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Adults living with a mental illness or in recovery who are treatment compliant

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit mental health support agency that promotes mental wellness in the community by providing information, referral, education, mental health advocacy and support.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Offers a support group for those struggling with mental health issues. Provides self-help information, group sharing, and discussion. Newcomers welcome anytime. Family members are encouraged to attend.
site_details: Walk in. (Meeting room is on south side of building.)
site_eligibility: Adults with a mental health diagnosis or friends and families supporting those diagnosed

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to build stronger communities through child abuse prevention, home-based services, youth placement, and recovery services.
site_name: FIREFLY CHILDREN AND FAMILY ALLIANCE - PLAINFIELD
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY (CPCS) - REGION 9
service_description: Provides a home-based child abuse and neglect prevention program to Boone, Hendricks, Montgomery, and Morgan County families with children. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs and may include case management, advocacy, parent education, and referrals to community resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS), or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open juvenile probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_name: EEL RIVER TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - HENDRICKS COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: EEL RIVER TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_name: HENDRICKS COUNTY FRIENDS OF THE SHELTER
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that supports the Hendricks County Animal Shelter and provides pet food assistance to Hendricks County pet owners in need.
site_name: HENDRICKS COUNTY FRIENDS OF THE SHELTER
service_description: Provides pet food and cat litter for Hendricks County dog and cat owners in need. Assistance is available for three months to one year, depending on individual assessment.
site_details: Call and leave a message with name, phone number, number of cats/dogs, and weight of cats/dogs. -- Call by Monday for Wednesday pick up.
site_eligibility: Living in Hendricks County -- Pets in compliance with rabies vaccines, tags, and proof of spay/neuter (or willing to work to meet these requirements)

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and frozen food to persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter to families with underage children who may be experiencing homelessness.  Also assist with connecting resources for various financial needs.
service_description: Offers financial assistance to eligible persons for short-term, emergency situations. Possible types of assistance include rent, utility, gas cards, and stranded traveler assistance. Help is provided on a case-by-case basis and depends on availability of funds.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Hendricks County -- Facing a temporary financial emergency

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter to families with underage children who may be experiencing homelessness.  Also assist with connecting resources for various financial needs.
service_description: Provides shelter and support services for families with children experiencing homelessness.  Also offers supportive services to individuals and families.
site_details: Call during intake hours. -- If space is available, intake will be scheduled.
site_eligibility: Homeless persons with children or pregnant, birth to 18 years; (over 18 if enrolled in high school) -- Alcohol and drug free; (screening is mandatory before entry) -- Agree to background check; (results assessed on case-by-case basis)

agency_desc: A collaboration of area churches providing a food pantry to persons in need.
service_description: Provides food each week for persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in the Mill Creek School District (Clay, Franklin, or Liberty Township)

agency_name: ABUNDANT LIFE - THE HOUSE OF MERCY
agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and clothing closet.
site_name: ABUNDANT LIFE - THE HOUSE OF MERCY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. May have personal grooming and toiletry items based on donations. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Visit agency's Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/ALTHM.CM/, page prior to visit to verify if food pantry will be open.
site_schedule: Monthly 2nd Thurs noon-2pm and 4:30pm-6:30pm; Monthly 4th Thurs 5pm-7pm
site_eligibility: Living in Hendricks County -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: A conservancy district established by the state of Indiana to provide collection, treatment, and disposal of sewage and other liquid wastes in the town of Avon in Hendricks County.
service_description: Provides sanitary sewer utility service for the town of Avon in Hendricks County.
site_details: Call for information and sewer emergencies, such as backed-up or broken sewers. -- Bills may be paid online, by phone, by mail, or in person; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Avon in Hendricks County

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry. Limited service area.
service_description: Provides perishable, nonperishable, and frozen food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Clients will be directed when to come in Door #3.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based organization in Indiana providing transitional housing for individuals recovering from addiction to substance use.
service_description: Provides faith-based residential treatment program for women who have a chemical dependency. Residents must attend chapel, Bible studies, and be willing to adhere to program rules. Services include community service, life skills training, mentoring, support groups, and referrals to other social services.
taxonomy_name: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit the website to download an application. An application packet may be sent upon request.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from substance use addiction -- Willing to commit to length of stay

agency_desc: A faith-based agency providing counseling services to youth and adults.
service_description: Provides counseling to children, teens, adults, and couples. Specialties include (but are not limited to): trauma, adoption, anxiety, depression, health/wellness, eating disorders, financial/debt mitigation, military/veteran, PTSD, abuse and attachment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial organization that offers DMHA-certified outpatient substance use treatment and mental health counseling.
service_description: Provides intensive outpatient treatment for people suffering with substance abuse and need a higher level of care. The program is 12 weeks, with 3 hour group sessions meeting three days/evenings per week. Following the 12 weeks, will be 8 weeks of ongoing relapse prevention and recovery support.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call an schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial organization that offers DMHA-certified outpatient substance use treatment and mental health counseling.
service_description: Offers counseling to people with depression, anxiety, addictions/substance use disorder, personality disorders, behavior problems, complicated grief, relationship difficulties, and other psychiatric and social problems. Services include individual, group, couple, family counseling, and trauma-informed therapy.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule first assessment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial organization that offers DMHA-certified outpatient substance use treatment and mental health counseling.
service_description: Offers counseling to people with depression, anxiety, addictions/substance use disorder, personality disorders, behavior problems, complicated grief, relationship difficulties, and other psychiatric and social problems. agency_desc: A commercial organization that offers DMHA-certified outpatient substance use treatment and mental health counseling.
service_description: Offers outpatient substance use treatment and counseling for adults. A comprehensive intake assessment ensures the appropriate level of treatment is provided.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: With substance use issues or concerns about substance use

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in the town of Avon and Washington Township

site_eligibility: Living in town of Avon or Washington Township in Hendricks County -- Persons who are homebound due to injury, chronic or extended illness or physical disability

agency_desc: Offers two full-service hospitals providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from any Hendricks Regional Health provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Financial assistance applications must be made in writing. Visit the website to print a Financial Assistance application or call or email the Hendricks Regional Health Patient Financial Services office to have the application mailed, or emailed.
site_eligibility: Received medically necessary health care services from Hendricks Regional Hospital   or Medical Group (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income for sliding-scale assistance; those below 200% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible for free care

agency_desc: Offers two full-service hospitals providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides baby items to parents in need. Supplies are limited based on donations received and may include clothing, diapers, wipes, and baby formula. Wait time may be two or more days.
site_details: Call; leave contact information and items needed; include sizes and/or type of formula, if applicable.
site_eligibility: Living in Hendricks County -- Without other resources for baby supplies

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the county or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Hendricks County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within Hendricks County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in Hendricks County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.

site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for Hendricks County.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect health and safety of  Hendricks County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquito, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Hendricks County

Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquito, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Hendricks County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

agency_desc: A commercial agency that provides electric and natural gas power in the Southeast and Midwest United States.
service_description: Provides electric utility service to customers in 68 Indiana counties.
site_details: Call or visit the website for assistance. Bills may be paid online, by phone, or at various   locations in specific cities or towns. (Visit the website to find payment sites.) Payments may also be mailed to Duke Energy, PO Box 1326, Charlotte, NC 28201.  -- To report a power outage or check outage status: Call or visit the website.Note: No walk-in services are available to the public at this location.
site_schedule: Customer Service: Mon-Fri 7am-7pm -- Power Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Customers who receive electricity from Duke Energy

agency_desc: A nonprofit, electric service provider.
service_description: Provides electric service within selection boundary areas.

site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Hendricks, Montgomery, Morgan, and Putnam County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Hendricks County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Hendricks County. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with board-certified family medicine physicians, internal medicine physicians and pediatricians throughout the state. IU Health offers a full range of specialty services for children and adults, including cancer, cardiovascular, neuroscience, orthopedics, pediatrics and transplant services.
service_description: Offers a support group for mothers who breastfeed; lactation consultants are available for mothers who are experiencing trouble nursing or have questions. Siblings are welcome.
site_details: Walk in to room K130 -OR- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Mothers and their breastfeeding children

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with board-certified family medicine physicians, internal medicine physicians and pediatricians throughout the state. IU Health offers a full range of specialty services for children and adults, including cancer, cardiovascular, neuroscience, orthopedics, pediatrics and transplant services.
service_description: Offers a support group for anyone with breast cancer or with a history of breast cancer.
site_details: Walk in to front desk for meeting room information.
site_eligibility: Persons with breast cancer or a history of breast cancer

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with board-certified family medicine physicians, internal medicine physicians and pediatricians throughout the state. IU Health offers a full range of specialty services for children and adults, including cancer, cardiovascular, neuroscience, orthopedics, pediatrics and transplant services.
service_description: Offers telephone reassurance, information, and support for women experiencing prenatal or postpartum depression.
site_details: Call and leave a message. Calls are typically returned within 24 hours.
site_eligibility: Mothers coping with perinatal mood disorders (either prenatal or postpartum)

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT MEDICAL GROUP - PLAINFIELD IMMEDIATE CARE
service_description: Offers immediate care for minor injuries and illness, including sore throats, ear infections, colds, flu, pink eye, asthma, sinus infections, allergies, and rashes.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

site_name: SAINT VINCENT MEDICAL GROUP - BROWNSBURG IMMEDIATE CARE
service_description: Offers immediate care for minor injuries and illness, including sore throats, ear infections, colds, flu, pink eye, asthma, sinus infections, allergies, and rashes.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Provides behavior change information to those at high risk of developing type 2 diabetes in a classroom setting over the course of 16 one-hour weekly sessions. After the initial 16 core sessions, participants will meet biweekly and then monthly for up to a year.
site_details: Call or send an email to enroll, confirm meeting times and locations, or to ask about potential financial assistance.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Overweight (BMI greater than or equal to 25%) AND diagnosed with prediabetes via a blood test (If blood test not available, can qualify based on risk factors.)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Provides behavior change information to those at high risk of developing type 2 diabetes in a classroom setting over the course of 16 one-hour weekly sessions. After the initial 16 core sessions, participants will meet biweekly and then monthly for up to a year.

agency_desc: "The goal of CICOA's Meals & More program is to provide appetizing, nutritionally balanced meals to older adults and those with disabilities either in their homes or at one of more than 30 neighborhood meal sites.  The program is designed to relieve hunger and food insecurity, promote socialization and address proper nutrition education." This program serves Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_name: CICOA NEIGHBORHOOD MEAL SITE - HENDRICKS COUNTY SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Offers a hot, nutritious lunch each weekday for area seniors. One day advance notice required.
site_details: Call the CICOA Meals and More Reservation Line at least 24 hours in advance to make a reservation.
site_schedule: Meals: Mon-Fri noon  -- Reservation Line: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older and your spouse -- Building residents that are of any age

agency_desc: Provides information regarding sex and violent offender registration in Indiana.
service_description: Provides an automated phone and Internet option for crime victims to find out the custody status of offenders in Indiana county jails. Individuals may also register to receive automated messages by telephone or email when a particular offender is released, transferred, or escapes.
site_details: Call or visit website to search for an offender or register for alerts. Offender's first and last name OR offender ID must be provided.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides information regarding sex and violent offender registration in Indiana.
service_name: INDIANA SEX AND VIOLENT OFFENDER REGISTRY
service_description: Provides the public with detailed information about individuals who are registered as sex or violent offenders in Indiana. The registry may be accessed online.Questions about a particular offender or about the information provided in the registry may be directed      to the sheriff's department of the appropriate county. General questions about the registry may be directed to the Indiana Sheriffs' Association. Questions about Indiana offender registration laws may be directed to the Indiana Department of Corrections,      which oversees the program.
site_details: Visit website and select the county to be searched.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Hendricks County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - HENDRICKS COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - HENDRICKS COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about civil matters and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. First come, first served.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: A county government agency promoting recycling, waste reduction, and responsible waste management within Hendricks County. Operates yard waste recycling centers, recycling drop-off centers and sponsors multiple tox-away days each year.
service_description: Single-day events for proper disposal of hazardous wastes, electronics, tires and appliances. Items accepted include automotive fluids, oil-based paints and stains, pesticides, herbicides, adhesives, solvents, fluorescent bulbs, batteries, cleaners, propane tanks, medical sharps, medicines, computers, TVs, tires, refrigerators, water heaters, and more. Latex paint should not be brought to Tox-Away Day for disposal; instead, dry it out and put it out w/ the normal trashShredding is not offered and heavy trash (furniture, construction debris, carpet, mattresses, etc.) is not accepted at Tox-Away Day.
site_details: Visit the website or call for tox-drop locations, dates, and times. For medication: leave on label information about the type of drug and prescribing pharmacy
site_schedule: Tox-A-Way Days: Vary; call or visit website for availability; Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm
site_eligibility: Hendricks County households; no business or commercial waste

agency_desc: A county government agency promoting recycling, waste reduction, and responsible waste management within Hendricks County. Operates yard waste recycling centers, recycling drop-off centers and sponsors multiple tox-away days each year.
service_description: Single-day events for proper disposal of hazardous wastes, electronics, tires and appliances. Items accepted include automotive fluids, oil-based paints and stains, pesticides, herbicides, adhesives, solvents, fluorescent bulbs, batteries, cleaners, propane tanks, medical sharps, medicines, computers, TVs, tires, refrigerators, water heaters, and more. Latex paint should not be brought to Tox-Away Day for disposal; instead, dry it out and put it out w/ the normal trashShredding is not offered and heavy trash (furniture, construction debris, carpet, mattresses, etc.) is not accepted at Tox-Away Day.
site_details: Visit the website or call for tox-drop locations, dates, and times. For medication: leave on label information about the type of drug and prescribing pharmacy

agency_desc: A county government agency promoting recycling, waste reduction, and responsible waste management within Hendricks County. Operates yard waste recycling centers, recycling drop-off centers and sponsors multiple tox-away days each year.
site_name: HENDRICKS COUNTY RECYCLING DISTRICT - PLAINFIELD YARD WASTE RECYCLING CENTER
service_description: Hendricks County residents may dispose of yard waste generated from their homes. Material accepted includes brush, limbs, leaves, grass clippings, etc. Fees are charged based on volume. Materials are processed into mulch. No stumps, sod, soil, building materials or trash. Material cannot be left in plastic bags. Cut firewood may be left at the center for others to pick up to use. Christmas trees are also accepted for recycling during the last week of December and first half of January.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Centers are open April through Nov; Brownsburg Location: Tues, Fri and Sat 7am to 5pm; Plainfield Location: Mon and Fri and Sat 7am to 5pm
site_eligibility: Households in Hendricks County; no commercial or business waste accepted

agency_desc: A  nonprofit agency providing shelter for domestic violence victims and their children. Offers faith-based services to persons in need regardless of race, religion or sex.
service_description: Offers a support group for women who have experienced physical, emotional, verbal, or sexual abuse. Topics include  healthy versus unhealthy relationships, dynamics of domestic violence, community resources, and personal safety. This group is lead by a trained facilitator and meets weekly at a confidential location.
site_details: Call the day of group to confirm availability and location. (No childcare is provided.)
site_eligibility: Victims of any form of abuse

agency_desc: A  nonprofit agency providing shelter for domestic violence victims and their children. Offers faith-based services to persons in need regardless of race, religion or sex.
service_description: Provides emergency housing for victims of domestic violence and their children suffering from physical, verbal, emotional, or sexual abuse. Services are provided in a supportive, Christ-centered environment, with the goal of reaching emotional and economic stability. Case management services, children's programs, counseling, support groups, housing, life skills, and legal advocacy are available.
site_details: Call for intake interview or visit the website
site_eligibility: Women and men with or without children (up to age 18) -- Fleeing any form of domestic abuse

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A church offering outreach to the local community including support groups.
service_description: Offers a weekly seminar and support group for persons dealing with separation or divorce. Participants may begin the group anytime before the last two sessions. Childcare is available when requested in advance.
site_details: Call or visit website to register.
site_eligibility: Persons who are separated or divorced

agency_desc: A church offering outreach to the local community including support groups.
service_description: Offers a support group for anyone who has lost a loved one. Groups are offered twice yearly for 13 consecutive weeks; may attend any or all sessions. Registration is recommended but not required. Childcare may be available if requested in advance.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Call or visit website to register.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older who has lost a loved one

agency_name: AREA FOUR AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area IV), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, or White County.
site_name: AREA FOUR COMMUNITY AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAMS - HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Provides free weatherization of owner-occupied and rental residences. Households must meet income guidelines to be eligible. Services may include attic insulation, caulking, weather-stripping, furnace repair or replacement, and heat duct and water pipe insulation.
site_details: Call to apply.
site_eligibility: Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Approved for energy assistance program (EAP) -- Landlord permission required for rental units

agency_name: VETERANS AFFAIRS ILLIANA HEALTH CARE SYSTEM
agency_desc: Provides comprehensive medical and mental health care for eligible veterans.
site_name: VETERANS AFFAIRS ILLIANA HEALTH CARE SYSTEM
service_description: Provides confidential inpatient and outpatient mental health and addiction treatment services for eligible veterans. Services include inpatient detoxification, outpatient substance abuse treatment, dual diagnosis treatment, mental health consultation and therapy, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) treatment, and vocational rehabilitation.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: New Patients: Visit the website or call the eligibility office to begin application process. -- Returning Patients (and new patients who have received a letter of approval): Call Primary Care for a consultation
site_schedule: Clinic: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Emergency Room: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservists/National Guard)

site_details: Call or walk in during office hours for information or to submit a report.
site_eligibility: Serves the town of Coatesville

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides electric utility service for the town.
site_details: Call for assistance. -- Bills may be paid online, in person, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Serves the town of Coatesville

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Hendricks County, the Superior Courts maintain dockets to handle small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Hendricks County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Hendricks County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Hendricks County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases in Hendricks County.
site_details: Varies; call for information.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Hendricks County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising adult and juvenile offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Adult and juvenile offenders assigned to probation by the Hendricks County Courts

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Personal grooming supplies and cleaning products including toilet paper, bar soap, toothpaste, laundry detergent, and dish soap are also generally available. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received food from this pantry in the past month -- For Cleaning/Hygiene Items: Not received cleaning/hygiene items within the past 2 months

agency_desc: Provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

service_description: Provides transitional housing for individuals and families who need help to regain self-sufficiency. Offers job training, and other support on a case-by-case basis.
site_details: Walk in to apply to be on the waiting list.
site_eligibility: Women, men, and children --  Able to work -- No violent offenses or sex offense convictions

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides a one-on-one evaluation with a licensed mental health practitioner. The practitioner will make recommendations for further services as needed, but continued counseling is not required. A written report is available 7 to 10 business days after the evaluation.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use and their families. Intensive outpatient services are available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone, Hendricks, Marion, Montgomery, Morgan or Putnam county

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides 24-hour phone crisis intervention for persons experiencing a mental health or addiction crisis. Crisis coordinators perform an assessment and then provide appropriate referrals to outpatient services, emergency rooms, pre-hospital screenings, or police contact for a wellness check. Current clients of this agency may use this line to get connected to the doctor-on-call for crisis assistance.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for crisis intervention.
site_eligibility: Experiencing a mental health or addiction crisis

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.

Current clients of this agency may use this line to get connected to the doctor-on-call for crisis assistance.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for crisis intervention.
site_eligibility: Experiencing a mental health or addiction crisis

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides a full range of outpatient mental health services, including assessment and evaluation; psychotherapy; individual, family, and group therapy; and addiction treatment. Case management, supported employment services and referrals are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center. School-based services available at some locations. Semi-independent living assistance and vocational rehabilitation services available for adult patients within the Cummins Community Reintegration Program.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 5 and older
